page.title: 08Farming in King's Lynn
page.content: The farm land in the given area is mostly reclaimed land. The highest point still only reaches five metres above sea-level. The south area of the map is now mostly built up and to the west, running in a south west/north west direction is the Great River Ouse. The area is roughly divided up into eight farms, most of which is rented out to respective farmers. The typical farming of the area is made up of a rotation consisting of wheat,barley, sugar beet,oil seed rape and beans.Other major crops grown are potatoes and peas.There is some grass land area for cattle grazing, or hay and silage.The cattle are both beef and dairy but is only on a small scale. Pigs are also reared.
